dxf2svg.svg
Class SvgElement

java.lang.Object
  dxf2svg.svg.SvgElement
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
SvgCollection, SvgObject, SvgReference
public abstract class SvgElement
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable

SvgElement is the abstract base class for all Svg Objects. This includes collections of SvgObjects, visible objects like graphic elements and invisible objects such as references.

Version:
0.03 - February 12, 2003
Author:
Andrew Nisbet

Default constructor.

Method Detail

getType

public java.lang.String getType()
This method returns the type of SvgElement that this object could be. In the case of SvgPolyline it could be a polygon, a polyline or a path.

setType

public void setType(java.lang.String type)
Sets the object's type. This may be required for some objects that are the same base object to Dxf2Svg but very different objects to SVG. After that we use this method to change the object's 'type' as required to render the object correctly in SVG. For a good example see SvgPolyLine.calculateMyUniqueData()

addAttribute

public void addAttribute(Attribute attrib)
This method allows you to apply attributes to this object. This method checks if the arg Attribute Attribute.equals(java.lang.Object) any other arg for this element and if it does it removes the old attribute and adds the new argument.

Parameters:
attrib - Attribute to be added to this element.

getAdditionalAttributes

protected java.lang.StringBuffer getAdditionalAttributes()
Returns additional attributes if any attributes specified.

getAttributes

protected java.lang.StringBuffer getAttributes()
This method allows the inclusion of additional attributes that may be defined by the user and are outside the scope of the conversion process. All subclasses can also use this method unless they specifically overwrite this method and do not get the extra attributes. SvgEntityDeclaration is one such class.

getObjID

protected java.lang.String getObjID()
This method will format the ID attribute if the object name has been set. If the objects name is set to null the object's ID is omitted and the object is said to be anonymous. Groups are made up of anonymous objects that should have IDs.

Returns:
String ' id="myID"'

getObjIDUU

public java.lang.String getObjIDUU()
This method will return the unformatted name of this object.

Returns:
String 'myID'

setObjID

public void setObjID(java.lang.String name)
Sets the object's ID attribute with, in most cases, the Dxf object's handle, but may also be set to the name of a pattern or the 'wire_run' if this SvgElement is a group that represents a wire run.

See Also:
SvgHatchPattern, AnimationEngine.applyAnimation(dxf2svg.svg.SvgLayerGroup, dxf2svg.DxfConverter)

setLayer

public void setLayer(java.lang.String laName)
Sets the object's layer name. Since the layer name is the argument String and almost anything goes as far as layer naming conventions in AutoCAD. In SVG it is a different matter. SVG uses this layer name as a 'class' for styling properties and class name cannot have spaces so we also replace all the spaces with hyphens. Do not confuse this with the class name though, this method only parses out (svg) illegal characters. A layer name could be 'Layer0' but its class name would then be 'stLayer0'.

This method will also check to see if it is necessary to change a layer for a piece of text or lines of a note triangle. This will occur if the '-notes' switch is selected. This is called layer normalization. Objects that are subclasses of the object and are on layer 'NOTESENG' will get converted to 'ENGLISH' layer so there is less JavaScript required to coordinate language switching in the SVG and to maintain consistency in the output. This all came into being to accommodate being able to find notes in a DXF. It was determined that finding such content was not possible (reliably) if the text was distinguished from other text by being on a different layer

Parameters:
laName - A layer name as a raw String from the EntityProcessor.
See Also:
setClass()

getLayer

public java.lang.String getLayer()
Returns the name of the layer that this object came from in the DXF or whatever Layer instance variable is set to. Do not confuse this with the class of an object. If this object's layer name is 'foo' its class name is 'stfoo'.

Returns:
String Name of layer (with svg illegal chars removed).

getOriginalLayer

public java.lang.String getOriginalLayer()
Returns the name of the original layer that this object came from. Do not confuse this with the real layer. The real layer refers to the group that this object belongs to. Some objects are placed on special layers so that there content can be identified, but after that occurs they should be moved to a standard layer so that they can participate in animations or other javascript events.

Returns:
String Name of original layer; may be null.

setIncludeClassAttribute

public void setIncludeClassAttribute(boolean yesno)
Setting this switch controls the inclusion of a class attribute. It allows other processes to change an objects class.

Parameters:
yesno - true include class class and false don't.
See Also:
setClass()

getIncludeClassAttribute

public boolean getIncludeClassAttribute()
Returns the switch setting that will allow or stop an SvgObject from including its class attribute. class and false don't..

See Also:
setClass()

setClass

public void setClass()
Sets the class value for an SvgObject. The default is the Layer name that the object belonged to in the DXF. If the class has already been set no action is carried out.

setClass

public void setClass(java.lang.String ClassStr)
Allows the setting of an SvgObjects class. Use this method to set the class attribute. To remove a class from an object use resetClass();

Parameters:
ClassStr - name of class without the 'st' prefix.

getClassAttribute

public java.lang.String getClassAttribute()
Allows the setting of an SvgObjects class. Use this method to set the class attribute. To remove a class from an object use resetClass();

getAbsoluteClass

public java.lang.String getAbsoluteClass()
Returns the class name of an object without the 'st' prefix. The returned String contains just the class name and not the whole formatted attribute String.

Returns:
string name of class
See Also:
setClass(), getClassAttribute()

setSuppressElement

public void setSuppressElement(boolean tf)
Allows the suppressing of elements during optimization of Svg file. This can occur if the objects are on a hidden layer or an image has a '0' value for its height or width.

isSuppressed

public boolean isSuppressed()
Returns the current setting for outputting of this object.

Returns:
boolean true the element does not get expressed false (default) the element gets output to the Svg.
See Also:
setSuppressElement(boolean)

setObjectVisible

public void setObjectVisible(boolean tf)
Sets the objects visibility. If the file is optimized this will supress the output of this element or alternatively it will change the object's visibility attribute to 'hidden'.

isVisible

public boolean isVisible()
Returns the current setting for outputting of this object.

Returns:
boolean true the element does not get expressed false (default) the element gets output to the Svg.
See Also:
setSuppressElement(boolean)

addAnimation

public abstract void addAnimation(SvgAnimator sa)
Allows an animation to be added to an object.

See Also:
SvgCollection.addAnimation(dxf2svg.animation.SvgAnimator), SvgObject.addAnimation(dxf2svg.animation.SvgAnimator), SvgReference.addAnimation(dxf2svg.animation.SvgAnimator)
